website_summaries.verdict: Engineered for dietary regulation and improved eating habits.
pros: We love that this feeder is created by veterinarians with a purpose of improving your cat's overall health
Customers report significant improvement in their cats' health
cons: Some cats may not take to it

customer_reviews.title: Good but spendy and needs some improvement in design
customer_reviews.text: Good idea, but the holes are a little too big and the dry cat food just spills out easily. Would be nice if the holes were adjustable or a smaller size was included. My cats took to this right away but then they were already used to treat balls. I feel this item is overpriced for what it is and the items price should be lowered to attract more buyers.
customer_reviews.author: Walters in Medford Oregon

customer_reviews.title: ... the hang of it but now they are doing great. I haven't found a single pile of "scarf ...
customer_reviews.text: My cats took a couple days longer than I thought to get the hang of it but now they are doing great. I haven't found a single pile of "scarf n' barf" since we started using the Indoor Hunting Cat Feeder. Filling the mice can be a bit messy--I now do so over a container so the food that doesn't slide into the holes doesn't scatter all over my counter-top.
customer_reviews.author: Ronica W.

customer_reviews.title: I just started using the trainer "mouse" and he loved it. Found it empty the next morning in ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently adopted a kitten found in an alley. He's a little wild. I just started using the trainer "mouse" and he loved it. Found it empty the next morning in other room so it seems he is having fun hunting for his food. I think it's helping him adjust to life indoors. We are now moving on the next level of hiding the mice around the house. Stay tuned!
customer_reviews.author: Martha E. Rich

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Quality product. Good way to get your cat to eat the way they should, by "hunting".My cat is not completely taking to this as I'd hoped, but is slowly figuring out how to get his food. I believe this takes time and patience.
customer_reviews.author: Jami L. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Openings are too big
customer_reviews.text: As lots of folks have mentioned, the holes are too big. My cats just tip them on their sides and the food falls out and they eat it. You literally might as well just put the food down on the floor. I have no idea why this was $40 and I'm pretty annoyed by that. I really wanted this to be something my cats would play and interact with, but it's too easy to get the food out. Such a giant waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: L. Harlow

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Squiggles immediately understood how to get out food. However he empties them immediarely, just like he was eating from a bowl - immediately! He doesn’t bat them around, just turns it over, eats and is gone. Does not seem on the least excited. I’m very disappointed. The holes are too large, no way to make it more difficult. We are both disappointed that it’s not more fun. Expensive lesson for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jody B

customer_reviews.title: I've already recommended this to every cat owner I know
customer_reviews.text: My cats were unable to get the hang of meal feeding wet food and free feeding dry to supplement -- in a small space, their tendency to overeat was starting to worry me. I started leaving a "snack" portion of dry food in the hidden mice before going to work and before bed. Not only are they eating appropriate portions now, they're also more active and engaged (no boredom when there's hunting to be done!), which is important in our small living space. I've already recommended this to every cat owner I know.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoyed this product
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed this product! My kitties love running around looking for their food and it has helped my overweight cat drop a few pounds! Make sure you're aware when you buy this that there are only enough mice to fully feed one cat. I didn't think of this and now have to fill them up multiple times a day for my 3. My only complaint would be that the scooper makes it difficult at times to get all the food inside the small openings. More often than not, I have a mess to clean up after feeding so I've resorted to putting a bowl underneath to catch the many stray pieces. That being said, I would still recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Pietzsch

customer_reviews.title: Patience
customer_reviews.text: Bluebell is not especially curious nor quick to learn. It took about 10 days to train her to use the mouse. At first I demonstrated how to spill kibbles by tipping the training vessel myself. That did not succeed and I took a more direct course; I held her paw and tipped the vessel with it many times over several days before she began to do it herself. Then she understood and took to the task with interest.
customer_reviews.author: Alan K.

customer_reviews.title: Aggressive cat turned mellow
customer_reviews.text: Thank you Doc and Pheobe for this product! My cat is a single cat home ( I know they are social creatures, but my budget says no, as well as my landlord) My cat being a single cat was always very aggressive with me. I've struggled finding toys, feeding systems, anything to help him stop being bored while I'm at work. Toys haven't done much, but this system. He has turned into the sweetest cuddly cat within a week of implementing this system. My only complaint is the covers are not very strong, my cat has already put holes in some of the covers, so I will have to buy replacement ones. Hopefully in the future, that will change.
customer_reviews.author: Trina P

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE -This is a GREAT idea in theory, but not I reality 😔
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE-CAUTION! Turns out my cats seem to enjoy eating the mice themselves in lieu of the treats inside them! This essentially results in every cat owner’s dream- they vomit the materials up. This has turned into a costly waste. I’m out of the retune date, of course, but would def NOT recommend. Loved the idea, but not the reality! I use them for treat hunting at night. I only put one or two small treats in each but they seem to find them all! It’s a fun little game for me and them. Lol
customer_reviews.author: ITGirl273

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, eliminates over eating/throwing up
customer_reviews.text: These have been great to eliminate over eating/throwing up and to stimulate 'hunting' for their food. We have 2 cats, one is a Savannah. Only con is they are slippery on our wood and tile floors, so they have to work a little harder to flip them around.
customer_reviews.author: connie.dyan

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: Description says it comes with 5 interactive feeders - it only comes with 3. The mice I received are not as shown in the pictures - they don't have the two holes in the middle, instead, they have a little tab hole that you can make larger or smaller based on the size of your kibble. Only one hole, not multiple. Poor review based solely on incorrect description and photos.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M.

customer_reviews.title: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE Doc and Phoebe
customer_reviews.text: Wow! No more scarf and barf! No more waking me up in the middle of the night to get fed! Changed my life! I ABSOLUTELY LOVE Doc and Phoebe.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Cats like them... but they are VERY easy to lose!
customer_reviews.text: I got these to make feeding time a little more exciting. At first the cats weren't interested, but I put in a few treats with each serving of food and that did the trick. I hid them all over--but the problem is, I can't remember where! I started out with five, and within a few days I was down to two. Where did the missing three go? I can't figure it out. I've looked everywhere. Did the cats steal them and hide them? Possible. Regardless, I recommend buying extras.
customer_reviews.author: Ash Williams

customer_reviews.title: Not for every cat
customer_reviews.text: After three weeks my 2 mature cats (10 and 8 yrs old) still look at the feeders with a whaat? look and utterly refuse to use them even when I remove their bowls at night and they are clearly hungry judging by the morning ruckus! Maybe this is for younger cats less set in their ways - as far as my cats are concerned this is a total bust.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but once he figured out how they worked it was amazing. No longer does he wake me up in ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to work with my cat (3, almost 4 years old) for about a week to get him to understand the mice, but once he figured out how they worked it was amazing. No longer does he wake me up in the middle of the night for food and he definitely lost some weight, which he needed. I stick to my regular feeding amount (1/4 cup for breakfast and dinner) but just divide it up between the mice. You'll have to work with your cat too (tipping it over, showing him/her that the mice are hidden), but once they catch on, it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Our vet recommended this to use for extra food during the day ...
customer_reviews.text: Our vet recommended this to use for extra food during the day as treats, not because our cat has issues eating. She is one of the smartest cats I have ever known (not bias or anything!), but she was not amused. She ate all of the food out of them when they were sitting by where her bowl goes, but she would not go hunt them!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t think it would work but I filled them and hid them around for my cat. To my surprise I came home from work and found them out of their hiding spots and empty! So I think my cat likes them although he still meows at his bowl so I still feed him in a bowl too. Overall it’s a bit of fun for your cat and I think it’s a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: An old cat can learn new tricks! He loves this!
customer_reviews.author: HC

customer_reviews.title: My cats are starting to figure the hunting game out ...
customer_reviews.text: My cats are starting to figure the hunting game out. My kitten really likes these. It doesn't work unless I use treats - catfood alone doesn't make them look for the mice.
customer_reviews.author: Raerae

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing - my 8 year old cat can find them and he is lazy persian who I thought would turn his nose up. I waited to review them because I wanted to see how good he would get, but I can hide them in and under things and he finds them!
customer_reviews.author: Florida Mom

customer_reviews.title: Maybe if you do buy this try those Kong treats that are like cheese in a can
customer_reviews.text: We are training the cats to play with these. We have cat nip in them and hide a couple of treats. They totally hunt and they put them infront of our door. So it is purposeful. Maybe if you do buy this try those Kong treats that are like cheese in a can. That would hold up well. But the size of the holes hardly holds treats in it. You have to be creative.with treats, but its worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna

customer_reviews.title: More interesting for the cats- they love it!
customer_reviews.text: These are great. One of my kitties hates using the food tree and waits for me to fill the little mice. He loves "hunting" them and will shake them like a dog to release the cat food. When he's hungry he brings me empty ones! Worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: makes eating fun!
customer_reviews.text: my cat routinely "hunts" toys at night for me so when a friend found this feeding system, i was instantly intrigued. I am so glad i invested in the system. my cat quickly adapted to the feeder mouse and was using the regular mice within a few days. she really enjoys the fun of eating, hunting and being extra active with it all. i totally recommence this to other cat owners. it truly makes eating fun for your furry friend!
customer_reviews.author: Molly Brislin

customer_reviews.title: my cat is a hunter now!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves to hunt down his mouses for treats every day, it's hard to hide them sometimes because he expects them, so he follows me around hoping I have one of his mice! We love having different ways to engage him in hunting and playing activities to keep him young.
customer_reviews.author: M. W.

customer_reviews.title: Playful cat loves hunting these mice
customer_reviews.text: Our new cat is very food motivated and playful, so this was a perfect combination! He figured the mice out right away and loves "hunting" them for his dental kibble. Adding this new form of play keeps him busy while we are away during the day and he has been less interested in playing with things he's not supposed to. A busy cat is a happy cat! 🐱🐱
customer_reviews.author: KMT

customer_reviews.title: One of the best toys I have ever bought for my cats
customer_reviews.text: Anything that keeps them interested for longer than 10 minutes is a miracle. And my boys still have fun finding their "mouseys" after weeks of hunting. I think they enjoy the praise as much as the treats.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Grey

customer_reviews.title: My cat LOVES this!
customer_reviews.text: This arrived on time and was better than expected! I like the removable covers and openings large enough for many shapes of cat food. My 1.5-yr old cat took to the mice right away and even carried one around for a while. I definitely recommend this feeder option!
customer_reviews.author: MyThoughts

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fill, clean, & feed.
customer_reviews.text: My two boys LOVE these feeders. Within 2 nights they caught onto their new nightly food routine. I can tell they're health & more active about their food. It helps that one of the rescues had been a stray for months, meaning he was missing stimulation from hunting he previously had.
customer_reviews.author: LittleTeacher

customer_reviews.title: Bowl free system works
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this. He’s enjoying himself and isn’t continually begging for more food.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Mocerf

customer_reviews.title: A perfect addition for our cats’ nighttime activities!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love these! I already did the “hiding/seeking food” activity with them, but they are really enjoying being able to attack, pounce, and carry and/or bat these around as they are getting the food out of them. Great product, well made, easy to use, and my cats love them. In a word... perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Angela E

customer_reviews.title: Must need a particular type of cat
customer_reviews.text: I love this idea, bu My cat never liked this toy. Maybe if you start it with a kitten they would enjoy and understand. But once they know they don’t have to work for food, they won’t.
customer_reviews.author: Sumer Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Maybe works better for smaller kibbles
customer_reviews.text: My kitties (4) learned to use them quickly. Did not use the trainer. The spoon filling left something to be desired. Maybe works better for smaller kibbles. Mine bounce off and become fun treats for the kitties to hunt out on the kitchen floor. Might recommend that a larger bore funnel be used.
customer_reviews.author: Janine Henson

customer_reviews.title: Cute but doesnt help Petries still crazy
customer_reviews.text: I like this and use them regularly for my cat Petrie. I am in the process of trying everything to get him to stop play attacking me because it hurts! I thought this would engage his intstincts and I would suffer less biting and attacks.. I have tried other vet recommendations but nothing is helping. Hopefully he grows out of this stage. He will be 1 years old next month. Any cat people out there, I welcome your advice.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Rossi

customer_reviews.title: 3 of 5 mice already lost heads!
customer_reviews.text: I'm trying to figure out why the skin on the mice capsules is made of fabric? It only took 3 days for my cat to chew off 3 of the 5 heads and all of the ears! Now he is a food crazed kitten, but he can't be the only one. The concept is smart, but there are less expensive ways to accomplish the same thing. Now we can still use the capsules without the skins, but we have wood floors. The middle of the night hunt could get noisy. The company should definitely reconsider the design.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany G.

customer_reviews.title: Great idea! Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great idea! Great product! It didn’t take my cat long to figure it out and she loves it!! She’s more active now and seems to enjoy tracking down the “mice” to get the food. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren J.

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use, hard to find!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great to keep my kitties occupied while we’re gone on weekends to prevent them from eating too much too quickly. I planned to use them daily, but due to the nature of these feeders, they are hard to find after the cats bat them around and under furniture and into nooks and crannies, so I can’t always find them to refill them.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Follow @zoey_ragnar
customer_reviews.text: Great! My one year old took to this the first night ! I put the test one out alone and immediately took the kibble out. I left it out before bed with one nice and both empty this morning. And I didn't hear him up and running around in the middle of the night. We both love it. Watch videos on Instagram @zoey_ragnar it's a hit !
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: There's a sucker born every minute. Took less than 2 seconds for my cat to know what's up with these "mice". Hiding them in places where the kibble won't spill out presents a huge problem unless you don't mind kibble falling down behind things. It really is alot of work and not worth the price. This is just another gimmick.
customer_reviews.author: DeeDee

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: The mice are larger than I expected and will hold quite a bit of kibble. I didn't find the trainer very helpful since the kibble falls out more easily than the real mice. To train my two cats, I filled a couple of mice full to the top with their favorite treats. They learned within a few minutes. The holes in the mice are small enough that it's somewhat challenging for them.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Tiffany Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great way for a one cat household to give indoor cats an active life
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea and would be a wonderful way to entertain one cat. I have 6, so I can't really use the mice as directed but can put freeze dried food in and hide them around so at least some of the kitties get some action. I don't use dry food as it's not all the great for cats, so that's an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia B. Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Cat & mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Of my 4 cats only two seem inclined to search these things out but they both look forward to searching them out. But I have lost one. Evidently I hid it too well. So I think these things might need tracking software. LOL. I haven't bought enough to use for my only source of feeding and I do have two cats that just won't engage in the search but I love using these.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: She has improved her quality of life and mine
customer_reviews.text: Loved the friendly packaging because my cat got a box and a new awesome feeding system. Directions were super easy and my cat is really enjoying hunting and she has stopped attacking me feet!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Katy Hickey

customer_reviews.title: Very dangerous if you have a dog
customer_reviews.text: I have cats and dogs. My dog played with it and got stuck on his teeth? A trip to the emergency veterinary clinic later it was off.
customer_reviews.author: ctctct

customer_reviews.title: A fun challenge
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these little mouse feeders. I hide them in different parts of the house and it makes his day a little more interesting. Even if your house is smaller these will give a fun challenge to your cat.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hoppmann

customer_reviews.title: The holes are too large!
customer_reviews.text: The holes are too large, so when you put cat food in them, it just falls right out! It wasn't even remotely challenging for my cats, and messy for me to clean up, so I'm returning the product. I love the idea, but they need to make the holes smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Jaynie Beard

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but.......
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 cats, only one is food aggressive and will hunt for her food (because she is obsessed with it). She, however, showed no interest in looking for food in these mice. Unfortunately, the mice did bring ants into our home- just another good idea that does not work in our home.
customer_reviews.author: Cristine K.

customer_reviews.title: These are actually pretty cool
customer_reviews.text: These are actually pretty cool. Our cat likes them and finds/eats from them. She’s an indoor cat and needed something beyond just eating from a bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Low_Light

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun.
customer_reviews.text: There are a blast. I put them out just before bedtime. I try to distract my cat so he won’t see where they’re hidden. It keeps him somewhat occupied at 2 am when he decides to prowl the house.
customer_reviews.author: C. Prine

customer_reviews.title: Captured my cat's interest as soon as I opened the box!!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I opened up the box, Taz started playing with the mice even without food in them! He knew this was a gift for him and I don't think I'll have any problems getting him to eat from them. They arrived two days early! Update, Taz is already playing with and eating from one of the mice!
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: 5 Bowls instead of 1
customer_reviews.text: Instead of filling one bowl this is like filling 5 small ones, dry food bits everywhere and I know It’s better to feed wet food and with this system it’s not happening.
customer_reviews.author: Keith C.

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this
customer_reviews.text: My cat figured this system out very quickly, although over time she started to treat the mice more like prey. Now she looks for them immediately at feeding time, and she hunts around the whole house looking for them. Sometimes she even picks up the mouse and carries it somewhere else to feed. And now she's beginning to leave me empty mice on my bed as presents. This system is wonderful. My vet recommended it and I'm so glad I went ahead and purchased it. It's definitely made my cat's life much more interesting.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Smyth

customer_reviews.title: I think this really gives my kits something to hunt ...
customer_reviews.text: I think this really gives my kits something to hunt for. The challenge is to hide them without them seeing you..lol!
customer_reviews.author: Debra K Martson

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it! My younger boy does the hunting and ...
customer_reviews.text: My cats love it! My younger boy does the hunting and my slightly older boy cleans up after him. No more scarf and barf, their eating habits are more evenly paced throughout the day and there is less begging for food as well. I ordered two sets of the indoor hunting mice so a bit pricey, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good form, lousy function
customer_reviews.text: These are a great idea, but the function not so much. The holes are too big for regular treats which means it falls right out. Where’s the hunting challenge there?
customer_reviews.author: peripan

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made.
customer_reviews.text: Have to create funnel with hand to get food/treats into mouse - can’t just pour with scoop. But, smart idea and they’re cute!
customer_reviews.author: Jones Family

customer_reviews.title: Holes too big
customer_reviews.text: The holes in the toy are too big to hold any cat food. All they do is flip it over and all the food falls out
customer_reviews.author: Donna Miller

customer_reviews.title: Pricey and didn’t work with my cats
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving this three stars because my cats could have cared less about this. But the quality is good. And it’s a great idea. It might be nice for someone else cats.thought it was over-priced and the mice were bigger then I thought they would be.
customer_reviews.author: tapDwyer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn, really works.
customer_reviews.text: My cat is very particular about her food, and is an older cat (eight or nine), and adapted to this feeding system within days. For the first time that I’ve had her, we are free of the problems that come with scarfing and barfing. So grateful for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Saved my relationship with my cat!
customer_reviews.text: Best idea ever!!! I work from home and have a Bengal cat (lots of energy). He used to destroy the house for attention while I was working which was a huge distraction for me. Since I got him this feeding system, he has been able to stay occupied on his own while I'm working. He enjoys searching for his mice. I enjoy hiding them in different places around the house. His energy is redirected in a positive, healthy way and he is much happier. He has also lost some weight (he was getting chunky). Thanks to this feeding system I have a better relationship with my cat, and he is healthier both physically and mentally. Best purchase I've ever made!
customer_reviews.author: Nina Leipold

customer_reviews.title: My cats don't care for it.
customer_reviews.text: The big holes in the product allows the small kibbles of catfood to drop out before it's even played with. There's nothing to play with if it's not hard to reach. My cats and my foster cats were not interested, no fun play factor.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: My cats are a bit lazy.
customer_reviews.text: My cats are indoor/outdoor so they aren't as motivated. I gave one to a friend's cat, who loves it. Mine are still working on the trainer mouse and the easiest setting, but they know that they can get treats from me the easy way (meowing). They do like it though.
customer_reviews.author: Lost In The Jungle

customer_reviews.title: Super great if you dont mind cat food particles everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Cool idea except my cat follows me when i try to place them. The real problem is that the cat food i use is a bit crumbly so if i hide these everywhere it means i will have cat food crumbs all over my house. So hence the 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Stylishchica

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool to keep her active
customer_reviews.text: Our 9 month old torti, Bender, loves these. She took to them right away, no trainer needed. I'm running out of places to hide them! Awesome tool to keep her active.
customer_reviews.author: NicoleJ

customer_reviews.title: Kitty finally got the hang of hunting for his food ...
customer_reviews.text: Kitty finally got the hang of hunting for his food. (Was accustomed to going to a dish and eating whenever he wanted.)
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Not for my bengals
customer_reviews.text: Super cute feeder but my cats didn’t get it after months of leaving them lay around. My cats are bengals, known to hunt rodents outside so thought this would be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Marble Rye

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves these
customer_reviews.text: Our 17 year old cat is having a blast with these - we don’t even use a feeding bowl any more. A real win-win.
customer_reviews.author: Peter S

customer_reviews.title: Best part of our cats day!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far one of the best purchases we have made for our cat. She absolutely loves to hunt for her food and when she finally finds it will pick it up and parade in front of us to show of her catch. This had made feeding fun for both us and our little girl!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Paxman

customer_reviews.title: Good for my cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat and her cousin have enjoyed these mice. They prove engagement, activity whilehome alone. Glad my friend told me about them
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Everything just perfect - thank you so very much!! 5*****
customer_reviews.author: Eliran

customer_reviews.title: These little mice are great! My girls love them
customer_reviews.text: These little mice are great! My girls love them. It gives them a little hunting to do within the house and they seem to really enjoy rolling them around to get at the kibble. Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: Kas

customer_reviews.title: Don’t skip the trainer mouse
customer_reviews.text: One cat loves these. He follows me as I hide them thru the house. He does go out and hunt for them
customer_reviews.author: Lisa G

customer_reviews.title: Great for kitties that like to work for their food
customer_reviews.text: We have a cat that will hoard food if she is free fed. After doing some research, we got her treat balls that we started filling food with. They worked well, so we added this in for some variety for her. She loves them!
customer_reviews.author: rsdc

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my cat
customer_reviews.text: Cool idea, but you would have to start out using this with your cat right of the bat I think. My fat old boy was not having it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kassandra Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: I've been gone a bit longer on some days due ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been gone a bit longer on some days due to a new job. My tabby, Connor absolutely loves his interactive hunting mice. I rescued him after he was hit by a car as a baby. Though he has a withered arm now he gets around perfectly, even climbing. However I dont let him outside and he is an only kitty so enrichment is important to us both !
customer_reviews.author: Diann Sugden

customer_reviews.title: I think it's cool. My cats are too dumb to figure it ...
customer_reviews.text: I think it's cool. My cats are too dumb to figure it out though. And I have a 14 yr old, a 12 yr old, and a 1 yr old (cats). So it's not just that the old ones didn't figure it out or were too lazy. The younger one bats it around, but not consistently enough to eat a meal from it. And the holes are WAYYY too big. dumps all the food out in about 3 revolutions. I put scotch tape over one hole and 1/3 of the other one, so I didn't have kibble spilling all over the floor with one smack of a paw. where's the fun in that?
customer_reviews.author: Shaina Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Stimulating toy
customer_reviews.text: Great concept, well made except for the tail part. My cat was able to pull it off and it's a definite choking hazard. I'm not using this as a feeding system as it intended but my cat definitely enjoys the challenge of finding them.
customer_reviews.author: Hoenlrj

customer_reviews.title: Older cats may not learn new tricks!
customer_reviews.text: Well made but my 10 year old cat was not interested in learning this training method. We gave up after 10 and returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Good for treats, not challenging enough for my cat.
customer_reviews.text: Good for what it’s for, but my cat is used of eating his food in a bowl, he’s not going to suddenly use this to eat. I do put some treats in it, however not challenging enough for him.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Depends on cat
customer_reviews.text: Great product but my cat doesn’t seem the least bit interested. Kind of wish there was a cover or flap on these since they spill easily.
customer_reviews.author: Geana Parks

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Idea!
customer_reviews.text: This has actually helped my cats (especially my chubby one) keep busy when eating and have a little fun while doing it. Training them to use it wasn't hard at all either.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Taylor

customer_reviews.title: my cat did not care for these at all. ...
customer_reviews.text: my cat did not care for these at all. she just made a mess, refused to eat the food from it, and still woke me up early am to be fed in her dish. i tried all their tips and hints, but my cat is stubborn. did come on time from seller otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Kelley

customer_reviews.title: My 7-year old male cat had no problem with the ...
customer_reviews.text: My 7-year old male cat had no problem with the transition from regular bowls to this interactive system. I give him two mouses in the morning, one at supper, and the final two at bedtime. We've been using it for a month and he meows less about his food. He's even dropped some excess weight!
customer_reviews.author: Connie C

customer_reviews.title: Say good bye to your conventianal bowl
customer_reviews.text: Well my cats did not understand the concept at first. Indoor cats are not use to hunting for their food. Now they love it.
customer_reviews.author: Reina

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it. Wish the holes were smaller though since ...
customer_reviews.text: Cats love it. Wish the holes were smaller though since the kibble falls right through.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Serial Killer Cat LOVES these!
customer_reviews.text: Great way for my cat to “hunt” for his food at night. Additionally, it keeps him from waking me for a midnight snack or play session. What a brilliant idea!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: My cats did not played with them. I donated them to the animal shelter.
customer_reviews.author: Atenea

customer_reviews.title: It is great. Its the right amount of dry food to ...
customer_reviews.text: It is great. Its the right amount of dry food to put in the tablespoon that is provided.
customer_reviews.author: Helen L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Only 3 mice not 5 like described
customer_reviews.text: Only received 3 mice and not 5 like the description said
customer_reviews.author: Stacey S.

customer_reviews.title: so far so good!
customer_reviews.text: we've been using this for two weeks and so far haven't seen any more piles of vomit around the apartment, and haven't been woken up at night by bored cats scratching on the door. even my dumb cat has figured them out. thank you doc and phoebe!
customer_reviews.author: sean barry

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My cat took to this system easily and the extra play really did help her behavior
customer_reviews.author: Amelia Nordin

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: Good in concept but poor execution. I’ve had these for about a month and they’re trashed. Once the cats have found them, they treat them as chew toys and have even eaten parts of the fabric that surrounds the plastic shell. I’ll probably move to an automatic feeder and have to eat the cost of these.
customer_reviews.author: MadtownAmazonian

customer_reviews.title: No Scarf and Barf!
customer_reviews.text: My cat is very much into her new way of eating. No scarf and barf since she’s started it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SueMac322

customer_reviews.title: Not much of challenge
customer_reviews.text: The holes are far too big. Pounce treats fall right out. Greenies fall out easily. Not what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Received this promptly. Products are high quality but it is missing the scoop. They contacted me and are sending a scoop and some extras. A+++ And our rescue cats LOVE eating from these mice!
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Chiu

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The vet recommended I get something like this in hopes my cat would lose weight. My cats never used them. I had go back to feeding them portions in a bowl. She is not a lazy cat, she just don't like this product.
customer_reviews.author: kim quary

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this! And they no longer jump on my head at 5 am to eat!!!
customer_reviews.author: kimhamer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The holes are a bit too big food just falls out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle J. Warendorf

customer_reviews.title: Great product for my cats!
customer_reviews.text: Cats love this product. Keeps them busy and they don’t wake me up at night!
customer_reviews.author: Krista

product_meta.title: Doc & Phoebe's Interactive Indoor Hunting Cat Feeder | Award Winning Active Enrichment Cat Feeding System
feature_bullets: Veterinarian designed to improve scarf and barf, night waking, litter box hit and miss and more
5 Interactive Feeders that allow cats to naturally hunt for their food
Durable plastic and tactile fabric skin appeals to cat’s senses of grabbing and clawing prey
Easy to use; Scoop your cat’s favorite food into the five mice all at once and hide
Easy to clean; BPA-free, top rack dishwasher safe plastic; Machine washable fabric
